info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 4:42AM PST until January 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches above 5000 feet, with a dusting up to 2 inches for valley floors. Higher elevation summits could see 8 to 18 inches of new snow. * WHERE...Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be falling through the afternoon and evening. There is a large boom/bust potential for snow totals in the 5000-6000 foot elevation range dependent on how fast snow levels come down. Any remnant moisture on roadways may freeze overnight with slick and icy roads through New Year`s morning.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
